heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded is on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 37.2 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: The lengthiest precipitation event recorded spanned 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025, it was characterized by a peak rain intensity of 4.6mm per hour and a total rainfall of 36.8mm.

most_lightning.status: The highest recorded number of lightning strikes in a single day is {highest_count} on {highest_date} since records began on 11 April 2025.

nearest_lightning.status: The nearest lightning strike ever noted was on 13 May 2025, at 4.97 miles distance.

storm.status: Stormy conditions are expected.  This is the first storm in the region since 15 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The ongoing rainy stretch, 9 days and counting started on 09 September 2025 and ranks 5th in length since records started in 23 September 2024.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is no cold snap at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 cold snaps, with an average of 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwaves.status: At the moment, it is not a heatwaves.  This year has seen 6 heatwavess; typically, 1.9 heatwavess happen every year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is south-westerly (204°).  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 2.1°C) and outside temperature (up 1.6°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 9%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 661 m) and light levels (up 5071 lux).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1145 m) and light levels (up 6263 lux) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 661.0m lower than yesterday, 575.6m lower than the past week, 1144.8m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 850m and a high of 2900m, averaging 885.7m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.
cloud levels.summary: Cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures should be quite comfortable. Outside; moderate and mild. Also, very clammy and humid and little or no wind. A few light raindrops may fall, cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times, and some sunny spells will occur. The weather will likely remain the same.
